document_data.name: ''Rhino Beetle Shield''
document_data.location:
[[Dorn's Deep]], [[The Spine of the World]]
[[Fort Tamal]], [[Western Heartlands]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Rhino beetle shields''''' were masterfully-crafted [[medium shield|medium]] and [[tower shield]]s that used [[giant rhinoceros beetle]]s' exoskeletons as their main material.
document_data.Description: These shields used naturally tough and light-weight insect carapace. [[Duergar]] smiths developed a recipe to cure and reinforce this exotic material to be as tough as any metallic or wooden shield.
document_data.Powers: ''Rhino beetle shields'' that were shaped to resemble tower shield were imbued with simple ''+1'' enchantments. Dwarven-crafted medium shields had ''+2'' enchantment. They also provided additional protection from [[arrow]]s, [[bolt]]s, and other missiles weapons.
document_data.History:
[[File:Rhino beetle shields.png|thumb|''A Rhino beetle shield of duergar make.'']]
In [[1281 DR]], an eccentric duergar smith [[Dirty Llew]] created a ''rhino beetle shields'' during his time dwelling in [[Dorn's Deep]] at the [[Spine of the World]].

In [[1368 DR]], a dwarven smith from [[Fort Tamal]], [[Jegg Hillcarver]], could shape giant rhinoceros beetles' shells into these tough shields.
